verses.verse: And when king<WH4428> Arad<WH6166> the Canaanite<WH3669>, which lived<WH3427> in the south<WH5045>, heard<WH8085> tell that Israel<WH3478> came<WH935> by the way<WH1870> of the spies<WH871>; then he fought<WH3898> against Israel<WH3478>, and took<WH7617> some of them prisoners<WH7628>.

And Israel<WH3478> vowed<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> unto the Lord<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, If you will indeed<WH5414> deliver<WH5414> this people<WH5971> into my hand<WH3027>, then I will utterly destroy<WH2763> their cities<WH5892>.

And the Lord<WH3068> listened<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of Israel<WH3478>, and delivered up<WH5414> the Canaanites<WH3669>; and they utterly destroyed<WH2763> them and their cities<WH5892>: and he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the place<WH4725> Hormah<WH2767>.

And they journeyed<WH5265> from mountain<WH2022> Hor<WH2023> by the way<WH1870> of the Red<WH5488> sea<WH3220>, to compass<WH5437> the land<WH776> of Edom<WH123>: and the soul<WH5315> of the people<WH5971> was much discouraged<WH7114> because of the way<WH1870>.

And the people<WH5971> spoke<WH1696> against God<WH430>, and against Moses<WH4872>, Why have you brought us up<WH5927> out of Egypt<WH4714> to die<WH4191> in the wilderness<WH4057>? for there is no bread<WH3899>, neither is there any water<WH4325>; and our soul<WH5315> loathes<WH6973> this light<WH7052> bread<WH3899>.
And the Lord<WH3068> sent<WH7971> fiery<WH8314> serpents<WH5175> among the people<WH5971>, and they bit<WH5391> the people<WH5971>; and much<WH7227> people<WH5971> of Israel<WH3478> died<WH4191>.

Therefore the people<WH5971> came<WH935> to Moses<WH4872>, and said<WH559>, We have sinned<WH2398>, for we have spoken<WH1696> against the Lord<WH3068>, and against you<WH6419>; pray unto the Lord<WH3068>, that he take away<WH5493> the serpents<WH5175> from us<WH4872>. And Moses prayed<WH6419> for the people<WH5971>.

And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Make<WH6213> you a fiery serpent<WH8314>, and set<WH7760> it upon a pole<WH5251>: and it shall come to pass<WH5391>, that every one that is bitten, when he looks<WH7200> upon it<WH2425>, shall live.

And Moses<WH4872> made<WH6213> a serpent<WH5175> of brass<WH5178>, and put<WH7760> it upon a pole<WH5251>, and it came to pass<WH5175>, that if a serpent had bitten<WH5391> any man<WH376>, when he looked<WH5027> the serpent<WH5175> of brass<WH5178>, he lived<WH2425>.
And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> set forward<WH5265>, and pitched<WH2583> in Oboth<WH88>.
And they journeyed<WH5265> from Oboth<WH88>, and pitched<WH2583> at Ije<WH5863>â€“abarim, in the wilderness<WH4057> which is before<WH6440> Moab<WH4124>, toward the sunrising<WH4217>.
From there they removed<WH5265>, and pitched<WH2583> in the valley<WH5158> of Zared<WH2218>.

From there they removed<WH5265>, and pitched<WH2583> on the other side<WH5676> of Arnon<WH769>, which is in the wilderness<WH4057> that comes out<WH3318> of the coasts<WH1366> of the Amorites<WH567>: for Arnon<WH769> is the border<WH1366> of Moab<WH4124>, between Moab<WH4124> and the Amorites<WH567>.
Why it is said<WH559> in the book<WH5612> of the wars<WH4421> of the Lord<WH3068>, What he did<WH2052> in the Red sea<WH5492>, and in the brooks<WH5158> of Arnon<WH769>,
And at the stream<WH793> of the brooks<WH5158> that goes down<WH5186> to the living<WH3427> of Ar<WH6144>, and lies<WH8172> upon the border<WH1366> of Moab<WH4124>.

And from there they went to Beer<WH876>: that is the well<WH875> whereof the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Gather<WH622> the people<WH5971> together<WH622>, and I will give<WH5414> them water<WH4325>.
Then Israel<WH3478> sang<WH7891> this song<WH7892>, Spring up<WH5927>, O well<WH875>; sing you unto it<WH6030>:

The princes<WH8269> dug<WH2658> the well<WH875>, the nobles<WH5081> of the people<WH5971> dug<WH3738> it<WH2710>, by the direction of the lawgiver, with their poles<WH4938>. And from the wilderness<WH4057> they went to Mattanah<WH4980>:
And from Mattanah<WH4980> to Nahaliel<WH5160>: and from Nahaliel<WH5160> to Bamoth<WH1120>:
And from Bamoth<WH1120> in the valley<WH1516>, that is in the country<WH7704> of Moab<WH4124>, to the top<WH7218> of Pisgah<WH6449>, which looks<WH8259> toward<WH6440> Jeshimon<WH3452>.
And Israel<WH3478> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> unto Sihon<WH5511> king<WH4428> of the Amorites<WH567>, saying<WH559>,

Let me pass<WH5674> through your land<WH776>: we will not turn<WH5186> into the fields<WH7704>, or into the vineyards<WH3754>; we will not drink<WH8354> of the waters<WH4325> of the well<WH875>: but we will go along<WH3212> by the king<WH4428>'s high way<WH1870>, until we be past<WH5674> your borders<WH1366>.

And Sihon<WH5511> would not allow<WH5414> Israel<WH3478> to pass<WH5674> through his border<WH1366>: but Sihon<WH5511> gathered<WH622> all his people<WH5971> together<WH622>, and went out<WH3318> against<WH7125> Israel<WH3478> into the wilderness<WH4057>: and he came<WH935> to Jahaz<WH3096>, and fought<WH3898> against Israel<WH3478>.

And Israel<WH3478> struck<WH5221> him with the edge<WH6310> of the sword<WH2719>, and possessed<WH3423> his land<WH776> from Arnon<WH769> unto Jabbok<WH2999>, even unto the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>: for the border<WH1366> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> was strong<WH5794>.
And Israel<WH3478> took<WH3947> all these cities<WH5892>: and Israel<WH3478> lived<WH3427> in all the cities<WH5892> of the Amorites<WH567>, in Heshbon<WH2809>, and in all the villages there<WH1323>.

For Heshbon<WH2809> was the city<WH5892> of Sihon<WH5511> the king<WH4428> of the Amorites<WH567>, who had fought<WH3898> against the former<WH7223> king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124>, and taken<WH3947> all his land<WH776> out of his hand<WH3027>, even unto Arnon<WH769>.
Why they that speak in proverbs<WH4911> say<WH559>, Come<WH935> into Heshbon<WH2809>, let the city<WH5892> of Sihon<WH5511> be built<WH1129> and prepared<WH3559>:

For there is a fire<WH784> gone out<WH3318> of Heshbon<WH2809>, a flame<WH3852> from the city<WH7151> of Sihon<WH5511>: it has consumed<WH398> Ar<WH6144> of Moab<WH4124>, and the lords of the high places<WH1181> of Arnon<WH769>.

Woe<WH188> to you<WH4124>, Moab! you are undone<WH6>, O people<WH5971> of Chemosh<WH3645>: he has given<WH5414> his sons<WH1121> that escaped<WH6412>, and his daughters<WH1323>, into captivity<WH7622> unto Sihon<WH5511> king<WH4428> of the Amorites<WH567>.
We have shot<WH3384> at them<WH2809>; Heshbon is perished<WH6> even unto Dibon<WH1769>, and we have laid them waste<WH8074> even unto Nophah<WH5302>, which reaches unto Medeba<WH4311>.
Thus Israel<WH3478> lived<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of the Amorites<WH567>.
And Moses<WH4872> sent<WH7971> to spy out<WH7270> Jaazer<WH3270>, and they took<WH3920> the villages<WH1323> there<WH3423>, and drove out the Amorites that were there<WH567>.

And they turned<WH6437> and went up<WH5927> by the way<WH1870> of Bashan<WH1316>: and Og<WH5747> the king<WH4428> of Bashan<WH1316> went out<WH3318> against<WH7125> them<WH5971>, he, and all his people, to the battle<WH4421> at Edrei<WH154>.

And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Fear<WH3372> him not<WH5414>: for I have delivered him into your hand<WH3027>, and all his people<WH5971>, and his land<WH776>; and you shall do<WH6213> to him as you did<WH6213> unto Sihon<WH5511> king<WH4428> of the Amorites<WH567>, which lived<WH3427> at Heshbon<WH2809>.
So they struck<WH5221> him<WH1121>, and his sons, and all his people<WH5971>, until there was none<WH1115> left<WH7604> him alive<WH8300>: and they possessed<WH3423> his land<WH776>.
